text.section: A real estate investment trust may file a certificate of notice for record with the Department.

A certificate of notice may describe:
An action by the real estate investment trust, its board of trustees, or its shareholders;
The occurrence of or change to facts ascertainable outside of the declaration of trust, as defined in § 8-203(c) of this title; or
Any other information that the real estate investment trust determines should be disclosed.

A certificate of notice may not:
Amend, supplement, or correct the declaration of trust of the real estate investment trust in any manner; or
Affect any rights or liabilities of shareholders, whether or not accrued or incurred before the certificate of notice is filed.
A certificate of notice is not a part of the declaration of trust of a real estate investment trust.
A trustee of a real estate investment trust is not required to authorize or direct the filing of a certificate of notice.

A real estate investment trust is not required to file a certificate of notice for any purpose, including to indicate that there has been a change to the facts or information contained in a previously filed certificate of notice.
A certificate of notice shall be executed in the manner required for charter documents by § 1-301 of this article.
